A Sonnet of Yester-month

SANFORD'S
FOUNTAIN PEN INK

Boys, the place to get your
meals—and they are honest-to-goodness meals, well
serve d, and reasonably
priced—is at

By a Member of Sigma Upsilon

MARCH
0 winds of March that tell of coming Spring,
And April with her weeping tears, her showers;
Once more you come and once again you bring
The promises of blustry days and flowers.
0 month that over all art truly king
Of 'sudden gusts that rock the highest towers,
How glad I am that once again you sing
Through newly budding trees and future bowers;
In winter months we long to hear your voice,
When fields are clothed in white and sparkling dress,
When glowing logs burn crackling on the hearth.
At last you come; there's reason to rejoice,
For your approach is signal of no less
Than days of joy and happiness and mirth.
B. J. Hood.

Boys, the place to get your
meals—and they are honest-to-goodness meals, well

priced—is at

By a Member of Sigma Upsilon

MARCH
0 winds of March that tell of coming Spring,
And April with her weeping tears, her showers;
Once more you come and once again you bring
The promises of blustry days and flowers.
0 month that over all art truly king
Of 'sudden gusts that rock the highest towers,
How glad I am that once again you sing
Through newly budding trees and future bowers;
In winter months we long to hear your voice,
When fields are clothed in white and sparkling dress,
When glowing logs burn crackling on the hearth.
At last you come; there's reason to rejoice,
For your approach is signal of no less
Than days of joy and happiness and mirth.
B. J. Hood.
